description:
Our Legal team needs more than attorneys to keep things moving. Our Legal Operations team is charged with improving and maintaining the Legal team's internal processes, systems and tools. Responsible for tracking objectives, coordinating financial planning and solving technology challenges, you are entrepreneurial, proactive and highly organized. You keep costs down, engage third-party vendors and make the Legal team's services better, faster and more efficient.

The Legal Online Operations team uses Google’s data-driven approach to make critical business decisions. As a Business Analyst, you’ll provide quantitative analysis to help Google scale its ever-growing/evolving legal operations. In this role, your responsibilities include providing and presenting insightful analysis reports, creation/maintenance of dashboards, and developing and encasing data pipelines. You will be working with multiple large sets of data, be able to translate the data into compelling stories to the stakeholders, and will be responsible for data consistency and accuracy across the reports. You’re a self starter and be able to work in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.

In this role you will craft scalable solutions for automating reports, dashboards and business insights so users can quickly and accurately know how key operations and processes are performing. You will work with users in understanding their evolving requirements and deliver practical and innovative data solutions that will benefit the organization.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for handling some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you take on unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience with SQL/relational database querying.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience managing and prioritizing multiple complex assignments, working globally and cross-functionally with multiple stakeholders.
  • Experience with spreadsheets.
  • Familiarity with data-visualization tools (Tableau).
  • Familiarity with programming languages (Python, Shell scripting, Google Apps Script, etc.).
  • Ability to work with and merge large data sets.
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize information to see the big picture while effectively managing smaller details.
responsibilities:
• Build reports, dashboards, models and tools to analyze, report and present stakeholder data that is associated with volume forecast, productivity, backlog and turnaround time per legal process or markets.
  • Execute quantitative ad hoc analyses that translate data into actionable insights for Legal Online Operations.
  • Create and maintain forecasting data models on key areas for the organization; deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, tailoring analysis and presentation methods to policy enforcement and risk strategies of the Legal Online Operations teams.
  • Develop and enhance data pipelines, workflows and queries based on large data sets. Work with Engineering and Product teams who create data pipelines to ensure proper dimensions and metrics are incorporated as needed.
  • Manage data related projects. Cultivate and enhance relationship with stakeholders.
title: Business Analyst, Online Operations
